page.title: 10BOW SCHOOL'S FARM VISITS
page.content: The junior children of Bow School visited 3 farms in this area which is mainly grade 1 and 2 red soil farmland.{1.PASCHOE ESTATE}a farm of 383 acres supporting a dairy herd of 150 Friesian cows.The milk is sold through the Milk Marketing Board to J.G.Quicke and Partners of Newton St.Cyres for cheese making.The calves are fattened as barley bull beef. { {2. HILLDOWN FARM}of 191 acres also has a dairy herd and is all grassland. { {3. NYMET BARTON}has a listed farmhouse and totals 161 acres. It is a mixed farm; arable,beef,cattle and sheep.These farms have mainly family labour with only one or two employees. The farmers are keen conservationists and at Hilldown Farm trees are preserved and hunting is banned.
